comments:
From RCP newsgroup thread "Error: Unable to acquire application service"


Thank you very much Steve, you got it working  ;-)

Nils

Steve Wasleski wrote:

> Nils,
>
> Try changing this line in you config.ini:
> osgi.bundles = org.eclipse.core.runtime@2,org.eclipse.update.configurator@3
>
> to:
> osgi.bundles =
org.eclipse.core.runtime@2:start,org.eclipse.update.configurator@3:start
>
> It is a bit of a shot in the dark, but I think the update configurator may not
> be starting so your plugin may not be getting started, therefore, you app is
> not found.
>
> Steve
>
> Nils Meyer wrote:

This thread involved 5 people, and took over a week before it was solved.
Can the error message in this case be improved, e.g. to suggest the correct
osgi.bundles= attribute.

(I know the default config.ini has the :start's in it)
I agree that this is a subtle area that is hard to debug but it is not clear 
that the runtime is in a position to suggest something other than 
perhaps "check you config.ini file" or some such.  Do you have some wording in 
mind?

The real question in my mind is why did hte user find they had to change the 
config.ini file in the first place?  Further, the default config.ini has the 
exact line needed but commented out as well as reasonable supporting comments 
as to the use of osgi.bundles.


Yeah, I understand the problem, and agree that the current content in the
default config.ini is already helpful.  How about "Do the appropriate items in
the osgi.bundles config.ini entry have the :start instruction"?  If you can
mention org.eclipse.core.runtime, that would be even better.
I changed the message to be:
Unable to acquire application service. Ensure that the org.eclipse.core.runtime bundle is resolved and started (see config.ini).

I also opened bug #135289 to document how to debug startup issues.

traces.message: Unable to acquire application service. >>>>>>>   at >>>>>>> >>>>> >>>>> >>> org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:267) >>> >>>>>>>   at >>>>>>> >>>>> >>>>> >>> org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:129) >>> >>>>>>>
